file_content.text: Thank you for your help.
Recover the key from the marauding Esh-kha. Activate the command console. Help me complete my mission.
Help me. A droid is not supposed to dream. This mind is overwhelming.
This prison was the creation of an ancient race, the Rakata. They are dead, but their machines remain, controlling the prison like an artificial brain.
I have been hooked into this brain for forty-seven hours. I didn't think it was possible for a droid to go insane.
I don't envy you.
Neither did I. The Empire will have to look into this technology.
A fascinating development.
That is part of my mission.
Insanity is to be embraced. Your enemies can't defeat you if they don't know what's coming.
Is that such a bad thing?
I am a droid. I am not used to illogical thought.
Sounds like a problem for an engineer, not a bounty hunter.
Not my concern.
An engineer would never survive the Rakata prison.
Tell me where this "brain" is and I'll destroy it.
So smash the brain.
The Empire does not want the brain destroyed. They want to harness its power for their own purposes.
Why are you hooked into the brain?
So disconnect from it.
I was built to interface with the prison brain and bring the prison's communication system online, so the Empire can use them.
I have found the communications network, but the command console requires a key. Records show escaped Esh-kha have it. I'm not programmed for combat.
Can I help you?
I'm not afraid of the Esh-kha.
Forgive me. My social interpretation algorithms are scrambled. Were you volunteering to help?
Not my problem.
Allow me to rephrase. Without your help, I cannot activate the command console and seize control of the communications network.
The Empire will not be able to get what it desires from the prison, and I will be bound to this brain forever.
I must humbly ask you to recover the key from the Esh-kha and reactivate the command console.
Oh, all right.
Certainly.
Thank you. The Esh-kha have the key to the command console. Once you've activated it, I will bring the communications system online and contact you.
No. [Refuse quest]
I cannot be freed from the brain until the communications system is reactivated. I do not know how long it will be until the brain overwhelms me.
What strange creatures these Rakata were.
